Class ShipBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.model.shipboard.ShipBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Level1ShipBoard, Level2ShipBoard, Level3ShipBoard
public abstract class ShipBoard extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a ship's board where ship components can be placed and managed

The board maintains information about ship cards, reserved components, and the last modified position

See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • ShipBoard

      public ShipBoard(int X_MAX, int Y_MAX)
      Constructs a ShipBoard with the specified dimensions
      Parameters:
      X_MAX - The maximum width of the board
      Y_MAX - The maximum height of the board

  • Method Details

    • addToList

      public void addToList(AlienUnit alienUnit, int x, int y)
      Adds an AlienUnit to the ship and stores its coordinates
      Parameters:
      alienUnit - the alien unit to be added
      x - the x-coordinate of the unit
      y - the y-coordinate of the unit

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Battery battery, int x, int y)
      Adds a Battery to the ship.
      Parameters:
      battery - the battery component
      x - the x-coordinate
      y - the y-coordinate

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Cannon cannon, int x, int y)
      Adds a Cannon to the ship and stores its spatial coordinates.

      Cannons are used to destroy incoming threats like meteors. The orientation and position of the cannon are critical for targeting logic.

      Parameters:
      cannon - the cannon to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the cannon is placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the cannon is placed
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if cannon is null

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Engine engine, int x, int y)
      Adds an Engine to the ship and records its spatial coordinates.

      Engines contribute to ship speed. Double engines require a battery to be activated.

      Parameters:
      engine - the engine to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the engine is placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the engine is placed
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if engine is null

    • addToList

      public void addToList(HousingUnit housingUnit, int x, int y)
      Adds a HousingUnit to the ship and stores its coordinates.

      Housing units store crew members and may be used to host AlienUnits, unless they are central units.

      Parameters:
      housingUnit - the housing unit to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the unit is placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the unit is placed
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if housingUnit is null

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Shield shield, int x, int y)
      Adds a Shield module to the ship.

      Shields can absorb incoming hits from specific directions. The orientation and status determine protection logic.

      Parameters:
      shield - the shield to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the shield is placed (unused in this method)
      y - the y-coordinate where the shield is placed (unused in this method)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if shield is null

    • addToList

      public void addToList(Storage storage, int x, int y)
      Adds a Storage module to the ship.

      Storages are used to keep materials collected during the game and affect scoring and abilities.

      Parameters:
      storage - the storage module to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the storage is placed (unused in this method)
      y - the y-coordinate where the storage is placed (unused in this method)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if storage is null

    • addToList

      public void addToList(StructuralModule structuralModule, int x, int y)
      Adds a StructuralModule to the ship.

      Structural modules are generic support components used to connect other modules. This method is intentionally left empty as structural modules are not tracked individually.

      Parameters:
      structuralModule - the structural module to add
      x - the x-coordinate where the module is placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the module is placed

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(AlienUnit alienUnit)
      Removes the specified AlienUnit from the ship.

      This action untracks the alien unit but does not modify its physical placement on the board.

      Parameters:
      alienUnit - the alien unit to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if alienUnit is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(Battery battery)
      Removes the specified Battery from the ship.

      This action will make the battery unavailable for future energy allocations.

      Parameters:
      battery - the battery to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if battery is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(Cannon cannon)
      Removes the specified Cannon from the ship.

      The cannon will no longer be used in meteor defense or contribute to ship firepower.

      Parameters:
      cannon - the cannon to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if cannon is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(Engine engine)
      Removes the specified Engine from the ship.

      This will reduce the ship's potential propulsion power.

      Parameters:
      engine - the engine to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if engine is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(HousingUnit housingUnit)
      Removes the specified HousingUnit from the ship.

      The housing unit will no longer contribute crew members or connect AlienUnits.

      Parameters:
      housingUnit - the housing unit to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if housingUnit is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(Shield shield)
      Removes the specified Shield from the ship.

      The ship will no longer be protected by this shield in case of attacks.

      Parameters:
      shield - the shield to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if shield is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(Storage storage)
      Removes the specified Storage from the ship.

      This may reduce the amount of materials the ship can hold.

      Parameters:
      storage - the storage module to remove
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if storage is null

    • removeFromList

      public void removeFromList(StructuralModule structuralModule)
      Removes the specified StructuralModule from the ship.

      This method is intentionally left empty because structural modules are not tracked in a dedicated list.

      Parameters:
      structuralModule - the structural module to remove

      Returns:

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the shipboard (x coordinate)
      Returns:
      The number of columns in the shipboard

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Returns the length of the shipboard (y coordinate)
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the shipboard

    • validateIndexes

      public abstract boolean validateIndexes(int j, int i)
      Determines whether the given coordinate indexes are valid within the ship's bounds based on the specific type of ShipBoard

      This method delegates the validation to the corresponding subclass, ensuring that each type of ShipBoard applies its own coordinate validation logic

      Parameters:
      j - The x-coordinate index to check
      i - The y-coordinate index to check
      Returns:
      True if the coordinate indexes are valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinate indexes are out of the board's bounds

    • checkIndexes

      public void checkIndexes(int j, int i)
      Validates whether the given coordinate indexes are within the allowed bounds of the ship. This method calls validateIndexes to verify the coordinate indexes and throws an exception if they are out of bounds
      Parameters:
      j - The x-coordinate index to check
      i - The y-coordinate index to check
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the coordinate indexes are out of the ship's bounds

    • loadShipCard

      public void loadShipCard(ShipCard shipCard, int x, int y)
      Adds a ship card to the specified position on the board **without any adjacency check**.

      DO NOT USE WHILE IMPLEMENTING THE GAME! This method bypasses the usual placement rules and is intended to be used exclusively by ShipBoardLoader during the loading phase.

      Parameters:
      shipCard - The ship card to be added
      x - The x-coordinate where the card is placed
      y - The y-coordinate where the card is placed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship card is null or if coordinates are invalid

    • placeShipCard

      public void placeShipCard(ShipCard shipCard, ShipCard.Orientation orientation, int x, int y)
      Adds a ship card to the specified position on the board, ensuring it is adjacent to at least one already-placed ship card.

      This method is used during the normal gameplay to extend the ship structure, enforcing the rule that new cards must be placed next to existing ones.

      Parameters:
      shipCard - The ship card to be added
      orientation - The orientation of the ship card to be placed
      x - The x-coordinate where the card is placed
      y - The y-coordinate where the card is placed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship card is null, coordinates are invalid, or there are no adjacent ship cards at the specified position

    • removeShipCard

      public ShipCard removeShipCard(int x, int y)
      Removes a ship card from the specified position on the board

      This method is intended to be used only during the initial construction of the ship

      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the card to be removed
      y - The y-coordinate of the card to be removed
      Returns:
      The removed ship card
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card is already null or welded

    • destroyShipCard

      public void destroyShipCard(int x, int y)
      Removes a ship card from the specified position on the board

      This method is intended to be used only during the CheckPhase

      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the card to be removed
      y - The y-coordinate of the card to be removed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the card is already null

    • getShipCard

      public ShipCard getShipCard(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the ship card at the specified position
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the card to retrieve
      y - The y-coordinate of the card to retrieve
      Returns:
      The ship card at the given position
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are invalid

    • setCentralUnit

      public void setCentralUnit(HousingUnit centralUnit)
      Sets the central HousingUnit on the board at the designated central position

      This method validates that the provided HousingUnit is not null and is marked as a central unit before placing it at the center of the board grid (typically at (7,7), adjusted by adaptX and adaptY).

      Parameters:
      centralUnit - the HousingUnit to be placed at the center of the board
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if centralUnit is null or not marked as central

    • reserveShipCard

      public void reserveShipCard(ShipCard shipCard)
      Reserves a ship card for later use

      This method is intended to be used only during the initial construction of the ship

      Parameters:
      shipCard - The ship card to be reserved
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship card is null
      IllegalStateException - if more than two ship cards are reserved

    • useReservedShipCard

      public void useReservedShipCard(ShipCard shipCard, ShipCard.Orientation orientation, int x, int y)
      Moves a reserved ship card onto the ship board at the specified coordinates

      This method ensures that the ship card is valid, has been previously reserved, and is placed within the ship's valid bounds before adding it to the board. This method is intended to be used only during the initial construction of the ship

      Parameters:
      shipCard - The reserved ship card to be placed on the board
      orientation - The orientation of the ship card to be placed
      x - The x-coordinate where the ship card should be placed
      y - The y-coordinate where the ship card should be placed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship card is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ship card was not reserved or the reservation list is empty

    • getReservedComponents

      public List<ShipCard> getReservedComponents()
      Return the list of the reserved ship cards
      Returns:
      the list of the reserved ship cards

    • getShipCardsNumber

      public int getShipCardsNumber()
      Counts the total number of ShipCards used to build the ship that are still not destroyed
      Returns:
      The total number of ShipCards used to build the ship that are still not destroyed

      public int getScrapedCardsNumber()
      Counts the total number of ShipCards used to build the ship that got destroyed or were reserved and remained unused
      Returns:
      The total number of ShipCards used to build the ship that got destroyed or were reserved and remained unused

    • getExposedConnectors

      public int getExposedConnectors()
      Counts the number of exposed connectors of the ship (assuming that the ship doesn't have any illegal connection)
      Returns:
      The number of exposed connectors

    • checkShipConnections

      public boolean checkShipConnections()
      Verifies that all ship components are properly connected
      Returns:
      True if all connections are valid, false otherwise

    • checkShipIntegrity

      public boolean checkShipIntegrity()
      Checks if the ship is structurally valid (all components are connected together)
      Returns:
      True if the entire ship is connected, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the ship has no components

    • checkOtherRestrictions

      public boolean checkOtherRestrictions()
      Ensures that additional ship restrictions are met:
      • All engines must be facing the back and have a free space behind them
      • All cannons must have a free space in front of the direction they are aiming
      Returns:
      false if any restriction is violated, true otherwise

    • checkShip

      public boolean checkShip()
      Performs a full validation of the ship, checking bounds, connections, integrity, and specific component placement rules
      Returns:
      false if the ship fails any validation check, true otherwise

    • connectAlienUnit

      public void connectAlienUnit(AlienUnit alienUnit, HousingUnit housingUnit)
      Connects an AlienUnit to a HousingUnit based on their coordinates and connector compatibility. If all conditions are met, the AlienUnit is linked to the HousingUnit
      Parameters:
      alienUnit - the AlienUnit to connect
      housingUnit - the HousingUnit to connect
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if not all conditions are met

    • getBrownAliens

      public int getBrownAliens()
      Counts the number of brown aliens present in the ship
      Returns:
      The number of brown aliens
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if brownActiveUnit is pointing at a purple AlienUnit

    • getPurpleAliens

      public int getPurpleAliens()
      Counts the number of purple aliens present in the ship
      Returns:
      The number of purple aliens
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if brownActiveUnit is pointing at a brown AlienUnit

    • getMembers

      public int getMembers()
      Counts the total number of crew members in the ship
      Returns:
      The number of crew members

    • killMembers

      public void killMembers(Map<HousingUnit,Integer> housingUsage)
      Removes a specified number of crew members from designated housing units
      Parameters:
      housingUsage - A map associating each housing unit with the number of members to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the map is null, contains invalid entries, references scrap housing units, or has null values

    • epidemic

      public void epidemic()
      Applies the effects of the epidemic AdventureCard to the ship

    • getTotalAvailableBatteries

      public int getTotalAvailableBatteries()
      Calculates the total number of available batteries
      Returns:
      The total count of available batteries

    • useBatteries

      public void useBatteries(Map<Battery,Integer> batteryUsage)
      Uses a specified number of batteries from designated battery modules
      Parameters:
      batteryUsage - A map associating each battery module with the number of batteries to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the map is null, contains invalid entries, references scrap batteries, or has null values

    • getTotalMaterialsValue

      public int getTotalMaterialsValue()
      Calculates the total material value stored in the ship
      Returns:
      The total value of materials

    • addMaterials

      public void addMaterials(Map<Storage,AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<List<Material>,List<Material>>> storageMaterials, List<Material> gainedMaterials)
      Adds or replaces materials in a list of storage units based on the provided new and old material lists

      This method ensures that the provided map is non-null and contains valid entries. Each storage unit is mapped to a pair of lists: one for new materials to add and one for old materials to replace

      Parameters:
      storageMaterials - A map associating each Storage unit with a pair of lists:
      • The first list contains the new Material objects to be added
      • The second list contains the old Material objects to be replaced
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • the map is null
      • it contains null keys or values
      • any inner material list is null
      • or the sizes of the new and old material lists do not match for a given storage unit

    • removeMaterials

      public int removeMaterials(int numMaterials)
      Removes materials from storage, prioritizing the most valuable
      Parameters:
      numMaterials - The number of materials to remove
      Returns:
      The number of materials that could not be removed due to shortages

    • getDoubleEnginesNumber

      public int getDoubleEnginesNumber()
      Counts the number of double engines in the ship
      Returns:
      The number of double engines

    • getEnginesPower

      public int getEnginesPower(int numBatteries)
      Computes the total engine power based on available engines and batteries
      Parameters:
      numBatteries - The number of batteries allocated for double engines
      Returns:
      The calculated engine power
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if numBatteries is negative or exceeds available limits

    • getDoubleCannonsNumber

      public int getDoubleCannonsNumber()
      Counts the number of double cannons in the ship
      Returns:
      The number of double cannons

    • getCannonsPower

      public double getCannonsPower(List<Cannon> doubleCannons)
      Computes the total cannon power based on the selected double cannons and the available batteries
      Parameters:
      doubleCannons - The list of double cannons that the user wants to activate. All cannons in this list must be of type Cannon.Type.DOUBLE and not destroyed
      Returns:
      The calculated total cannon power
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list contains non-double or destroyed cannons, or if the number of selected cannons exceeds the available batteries

    • isBeingProtected

      public boolean isBeingProtected(Hit.Direction direction)
      Determines whether this ship is being protected from the given direction by any functional shield
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction from which an attack is coming
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one active shield protecting from the given direction, false otherwise

    • canDestroy

      public List<Cannon> canDestroy(Hit.Direction direction, int coordinate)
      Determines which cannons can be used to destroy a big meteor coming from the given direction and coordinate
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction from which a big meteor is coming
      coordinate - The coordinate from which a big meteor is coming
      Returns:
      A list of Cannon objects that can be used to destroy the meteor. If no cannons are available, returns an empty list

    • hasAnExposedConnector

      public boolean hasAnExposedConnector(Hit.Direction direction, int coordinate)
      Determines whether this ship has an exposed connector in the given direction and coordinate
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction from which a little meteor is coming
      coordinate - The coordinate from which a little meteor is coming
      Returns:
      true if the ship has an exposed connector in the given direction and coordinate, false otherwise

    • destroyHitComponent

      public boolean destroyHitComponent(Hit.Direction direction, int coordinate)
      Determines which component is going to be destroyed by a hit
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction from which a hit is coming
      coordinate - The coordinate from which a hit is coming
      Returns:
      true if a ShipCard was destroyed by the hit, false otherwise

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this ShipBoard to the specified object for equality.

      Two ShipBoard instances are considered equal if:

      • They are of the same concrete subclass
      • Each position in their components matrices contains equal ShipCard instances (according to equals)
      • Their reservedComponents lists are equal

      Note: Spatial metadata such as coordinates of components (e.g. cannonCoordinates) and internal state (e.g. alien activations or component statuses) are not considered in this comparison.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with this ship board
      Returns:
      true if the two ship boards are equal in structure and reserved cards, false otherwise
